info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 3:53PM CDT until March 31 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT FOR EAST CENTRAL ROCK ISLAND...CENTRAL WHITESIDE AND NORTH CENTRAL HENRY COUNTIES... At 353 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Erie, or 11 miles southwest of Morrison, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Morrison, Lyndon, Round Grove, Whiteside County Fairgrounds, Unionville, Morrison-Rockwood State Park, Emerson, Agnew, Galt, Como, Malvern, Grimes Addition, Douglas Park and Sterling. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northwestern Illinois.
